context_evidences: - Commenting on the court decision, Tate's lawyer Eugen Constantin Vidineac told reporters: "From our perspective, there are no grounds... for taking this most drastic preventive measure, but it is the judge's prerogative." Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06

- Despite his arrest, Tate’s controversial Twitter account has continued to remain active, with a post on Sunday citing a Romanian media article about one of the Tate brothers being hospitalized, with the caption: “The Matrix has attacked me. But they misunderstand, you cannot kill an idea. Hard to Kill.” The account has also continued to retweet Tate’s supporters, who insist he is innocent and a victim of a conspiracy. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2023/01/10/andrew-tate-loses-bid-to-end-30-day-detention-on-rape-and-human-trafficking-charges/ published on 2023-01-10 15:49:11

- Prosecutors said the Tate brothers had been under criminal investigation since April. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06

- Insider reached out to Romania's DIICOT agency and the prison police commissioner but has not heard back. Tate's team did not respond to Insider's email or direct messages to his Twitter account, so the investigation remains open. Reference: https://www.insider.com/andrew-tate-probably-not-tweeting-from-jail-2023-1 published on 2023-01-20 11:04:54

- The court’s decision means Tate, a former kickboxer and reality TV star, must remain in custody in Romania while officials continue their investigation into organized crime. Reference: https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2023/01/10/andrew-tate-loses-bid-to-end-30-day-detention-on-rape-and-human-trafficking-charges/ published on 2023-01-10 15:49:11

- Romanian lawyer Stefan Loredan, who has a practice in Dubai but has followed Tate's case closely, told Insider that Tate would not be allowed to have a phone in jail. Reference: https://www.insider.com/andrew-tate-probably-not-tweeting-from-jail-2023-1 published on 2023-01-20 11:04:54
correction_response:
This tweet is potentially misleading. While Andrew Tate is indeed in detention in Romania, the term "solitary confinement" may not be accurate. The tweet seems to be based on a post from Tate's Twitter account, but it's important to note that inmates in Romania are not allowed to have phones in jail, according to a Romanian lawyer. This suggests that Tate himself may not be the one posting these tweets. Furthermore, the investigation into Tate's alleged crimes is still ongoing, and he has not been found guilty yet. 

References:
https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/
https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2023/01/10/andrew-tate-loses-bid-to-end-30-day-detention-on-rape-and-human-trafficking-charges/
https://www.insider.com/andrew-tate-probably-not-tweeting-from-jail-2023-1
note_1_text: The Romanian police have not commented on Andrew Tate being held in solitary confinement, and there are no reports about him being held in solitary confinement. However, Andrew Tate's detention in a Romanian jail has been extended until February 27.    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/boxing/breaking-andrew-tate-detention-extended-29007139
note_2_text: This is pure speculation based on a tweet from Andrew Tates's Twitter account, which could mean anything. The Romanian police have not confirmed this, and there are no other reports about him being in solitary confinement.    https://twitter.com/Cobratate/status/1616170807948120064?s=20&t=CkRWK-5Rw0_DhpPSrrhsQg

refute_evidences: - A Romanian court agreed late on Friday to extend the detention of Andrew Tate by 30 days, after the divisive internet personality was arrested on suspicion of human trafficking, rape and forming an organised crime group. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06

- The former professional kickboxer and his brother Tristan were detained on Thursday for an initial 24 hours alongside two Romanian suspects, prosecutors from the anti-organised crime unit said after raiding their properties in Bucharest. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06
